institution: Human Resources Development Service of Korea
contents: Article 3 (Definition) The meanings of terms used in these rules are as follows: 1. Project progress committee member refers to a person appointed as a progress committee member for interviews (interviews) related to overseas employment, job fairs, various meetings, etc. ., 2. Sanctions Committee refers to a committee formed to review the severity of the issue and take action against operating institutions that have problems during the period of participation in the Global Job Support Project., 3. World Job Plus refers to the overseas expansion committee. Refers to a dedicated portal site operated by the Corporation for support., 4. Job seeker refers to a Korean citizen who has registered with World Job Plus for the purpose of advancing overseas, such as overseas employment, overseas start-up, or overseas internship., 5. Recruitment agency. “Employed” refers to a company with a corporation or business office located overseas and registered with World Job Plus to hire Korean citizens. 6. “Employed” refers to a person who signs an employment contract with a recruiting company, obtains a visa that allows him/her to legally work, and leaves the country. Refers to one person., 7. Operating organization refers to an organization that participates in the corporation's global job support project., 8. Prospective employee refers to a job seeker who has decided to be hired by a recruiting company., 9. Placement. refers to promoting employment by providing information on job seekers that meet the hiring conditions of the recruiting company to the recruiting agency., 10. Cost support placement refers to supporting the cost of overseas employment directly or indirectly to the job seeker. It refers to promoting employment., 11. General placement refers to promoting employment by providing overseas employment support services without separate cost support to job seekers, such as the operation of World Job Plus and job fairs., 12. Training D. refers to an education and training course to improve job competency and language level of job seekers in order to promote overseas expansion., 13. Training target refers to job seekers selected to participate in No. 12 (training) course. says
